title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
tagline: Brown butter, toffee notes, crispy edges, chewy center.
description: Brown butter, chewy center, crispy edges, toffee notes. The ATK method. Makes 16.
ingredients: ¾ cup dark brown sugar, packed
steps: Whisk flour and baking soda in bowl. Set aside.
Brown the butter: Melt 10 tbsp butter in skillet over medium-high heat, swirling constantly. Cook until milk solids turn dark golden brown and smell nutty, about 3 minutes. Transfer to large bowl.
Add remaining 4 tbsp butter to hot browned butter. Stir until melted.
Add both sugars, salt, and vanilla. Whisk until combined.
Add egg and yolk. Whisk vigorously for 30 seconds. Let rest 3 minutes. Whisk 30 seconds. Rest 3 minutes. Whisk 30 seconds. (This develops structure.)
Fold in flour mixture until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Roll dough into 16 balls (about 3 tablespoons each). Place on parchment-lined baking sheets, 2 inches apart.
Bake at 375°F for 10-14 minutes until golden brown on edges but still soft in center.
Cool on pan 5 minutes, then transfer to rack.
notes: BROWN THE BUTTER: This is the secret. Creates toffee/nutty flavor that's unmistakable.
Dark brown sugar: More molasses = chewier cookie. Don't substitute light.
The whisking/resting: Sounds fussy but it dissolves sugar and creates a glossy, crackly top.
1 egg + 1 yolk: Extra yolk = chewier texture. Whole eggs make cakier cookies.
Underbake slightly: They firm up as they cool. Golden edges, soft center = perfect.
